oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Consolidated morning report of the 154th Senior Infantry Regiment stationed at Shelbyville
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865 -- Registers, lists, etc.; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Report of the status of the men of the Confederate 154th Senior Infantry Regiment listed by command company. It shows the status of men present: ready for duty, sick, extra duty, or under arrest; it also shows the status of those absent: detached service, with leave, and without leave. Information includes the totals and any changes from the previous day. It is signed by commanding officer Lt. Colonel M. Mageveney Jr.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Confederate States of America -- War Dept.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Consolidated morning reports listed the number of men available for duty in a certain regiment. The detailed list showed the numbers of officers, non-commissioned officers, enlisted men, surgeons, etc., available within each company. Reports were issued daily to ensure that an accurate count was always available. The "Senior" in this unit's designation indicates that it antedated lower-numbered Tennessee regiments in the Civil War. The "154" comes from its 1842 founding as a Tennessee Militia regiment that incorporated in 1860. With the war, the unit reorganized at Randolph in Shelby County.
